Articles.Content: OMG OMG. Thanks Tiberion

What is with the WoT team audio in the background???

Also:

I never really like the complexity of this pack.

Still rather nice.

guild mates I was chatting with were in WoT at the time. Gaming is more about the company then the game imo.

For the people that were having memory crash issues with the Engines folder installed, I have a down-res'd version of the textures for you guys to try out and see if it reduces the problem any:

http://www./?bjibzih490ibiht (thx to frizzank again for the extra work)

If that doesn't break something else, I'll include those and the other already fixed bugs and release a 2.0a final release tomorrow sometime.

By the way, if anyone has some cool example .craft files of things built with Novapunch 2; I would love to have some better ones to include with the downloads. I've been doing it so long they all sort of turn out the same.

They can include stock parts too, but no other mods)

Also, I would love a new video to feature using the new version, the old videos are pretty out of date now. Could be a review or an introduction to the pack, or whatever your imagination can come up with. Doesn't have to be done for the release of course.

Also screenshots! I use all sorts of screenshots to make the info-graphics and such.
thank you so much, wasnt able to launch with the the other release, no problems so far with the down-res'd textures

Excelent work.

I'm seeing no problems under linux-64bit. I had forgotten how much I missed these engines.

For anyone creating new parts, forget the big stuff. I want more sub-1m parts for use in probes.

Excelent work.

I'm seeing no problems under linux-64bit. I had forgotten how much I missed these engines.

For anyone creating new parts, forget the big stuff. I want more sub-1m parts for use in probes.

Agreed.more probe parts is a must.
There is a new 1.25 m fuel tank,
OK, I need to try and assemble a new build of the Martin M-410. If successful, I'll call it the NP-410. I've already remade it using FASA parts, and it is dead solid reliable.
also a .625m tank in there as well.
I tested two NP rockets that came with the mod. The NP Odin is way laggy to take to orbit. So far, no lags. I'll test it with Deadly Reetry later.

I made a nice moon rocket that may work as an example craft. It's a little large but is very stable when it flies. Here is an album of it:http://imgur.com/a/HRT4P#0 and here is the .craft for it: http://www./download/iou1hauccikl3a0/lander_1_launcher_submit.craft

Edited July 1, 2013 by CaptMorgan13

I made a nice moon rocket that may work as an example craft. It's a little large but is very stable when it flies. Here is an album of it:http://imgur.com/a/HRT4P#0 and here is the .craft for it: http://www./download/iou1hauccikl3a0/lander_1_launcher_submit.craft

Doh! I just got done uploading the release, or I would have tossed your craft file in. I'll certainly do so next time, looks great

So yes, that means that the release is officially "Out" and is now available on Spaceport and via the Mediafire mirror (found on the front page)

In addition to a couple of bug fixes and the tweaks to the texture sizes, frizzank delivered the new fairing plates for the fairings he had redone recently. The fairings now look really nice and work great.

As always, there are probably bugs we've missed, and keep in mind things are still being added/replaced as time allows.

Enjoy!
Hey. I'm not sure if it's NP fault but my KSP has started encountering major crashes recently. Random 'oops' crashes.

Sounds like the KSP memory crash, which is typically caused by having too many mod parts loaded (or too much memory used by parts with large textures.) NP of course has a lot of parts and some texture bloat - try the release I just pushed out, it had some downsized textures from the initial alpha 'test' release which may help some.

Sounds like the KSP memory crash, which is typically caused by having too many mod parts loaded (or too much memory used by parts with large textures.) NP of course has a lot of parts and some texture bloat - try the release I just pushed out, it had some downsized textures from the initial alpha 'test' release which may help some.

Yes. I just tried the new upload and it seems to be loading. However it could be my modstack as well. Thanks for the response.

Edit:Still crashing in different way. I'm gonna grab a clean install of KSP and see if i can get to the bottom of this.

Edited July 1, 2013 by internerd
Why have you removed M-50 saturn engine?
Need to fix it. Orbital Bertha is smaller than 2.5m.
The old Orbital Bertha engine also appeared slightly smaller than the 2.5m fuel tank, but the fairing for it was correctly sized, so it's really only an aesthetic issue.
All engines are getting a huge update. Its going to take some, time....
20.0 compatibale?
Yep, though I recommend using 0.20.2.
I'm pretty sure this aint supposed to happen...

I'm pretty sure this aint supposed to happen...

yeah those are totally unusable for me now, even with stock parts altho i dont have pics

Thank you!

My favorite set of parts. BTW, since your optimization, I am no longer experiencing the memory problem. think I am pretty close to maxed out on mods though....hehehe, Marvelous pack!

I think I figured out the problem with the lag on the Thor Lander legs. I was baking out all the frames in the animation without any optimization. I re-exported it with an optimize animation tick-box on the fbx exporter and its seems to have fixed the problem.

Also created some probe sized gear.
